isis.stitle: GAUGES AND WARNING LIGHTS - REMOVE AND INSTALL - SPEEDO/TACH MODULE

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. LOCATION FOR DIGITAL OR MECHANICAL ODOMETER
8. MODULE COVER RETAINING SCREWS (SIX - TWO TOP AND BOTTOM, AND ONE ON EACH SIDE)

svcprocinfo.para: To remove this module, remove the screw in each of the four corners of the module and remove the module from the instrument panel far enough to disconnect the two 20-terminal, module connectors (421) and (422) to complete removal. The connector for (421) is white and the connector for (422) is yellow.

svcsubproc.title: Speedo/Tach Module Face Plate
svcsubproc.para: The face plate is removed just like with the General Instrument/Pollak cluster that this module replaced.

step1.para: With the module removed from the instrument panel, remove six screws:

step2.para: Two screws on the top side
Two screws on the bottom side
One screw on the right and left side.

step1.para: To install face plate, reverse the above process.

svcsubproc.title: Speedometer Or Tachometer Gauge
svcsubproc.para: Remove the module face plate as outlined above. Then grasp the gauge and lift straight out. To install, reverse the process.

svcsubproc.title: Mechanical Odometer
svcsubproc.para: With the Speedo/Tach module removed, the mechanical odometer is fastened to the rear lower corner (behind speedometer) of the module by three screws.

step1.para: Remove the three screws and unplug J3 connector (marked J3 on circuit board).

When installing the odometer, align the odometer to the opening in the speedometer gauge, before final tightening of the three screws. Be sure to plug the odometer in again before installing the module.

svcsubproc.title: Alarm Buzzer
svcsubproc.para: The alarm (round shape) is fastened to the bottom side of the module by two screws. Remove the two screws, unplug connector J4 (marked J4 on circuit board) and remove. To install, reverse the process.

svcsubproc.title: Digital Odometer
svcsubproc.para: Remove the front face plate from the control module by removing the six screws.

step1.para: Remove the speedometer gauge to access the odometer.
Remove the four mounting screws. The digital odometer is mounted on four stand-offs, separating it from the main circuit board.
Disconnect J3 connector (marked J3 on the circuit board). Remove the odometer.
To install, reverse the process. (Note that the main memory of the circuit board stores the information, so the new digital odometer will display the previous mile and hours data.)

svcsubproc.title: Speedo/Tach Module Light Bulbs
svcsubproc.para: The turn and high beam indicator light bulbs fit into connectors that snap into the turn indicator light housing.

step1.para: Turn and high beam indicator bulbs are accessed by removing the connector from the light housing. Refer to Bulb Chart.

step2.para: The orange leads go to the right turn indicator.
The blue leads go to the high beam indicator.
The yellow leads go to the left turn indicator.

step1.para: The panel light bulbs are twist lock connectors. Turn counterclockwise to remove. Refer to Bulb Chart.
